nodes.bodyText: I don't understand this if check. FilterQueryMap is flattened and contained all the FilterQuery. We just need to iterate on all these FilterQuery which are stored in "values" and that will take care of fixing the column name for the entire tree
we just need to check the leaf nodes in the filtertree. this check ensures that we dont process intermediate nodes like (AND/OR)
Got it.
We should recurse for FUNCTION expression to identify the inner column names (IDENTIFIERS) at the leaf level and fix case for them
If we are not planning to handle column names for cases like SUM(ADD(col_a, col_b)) in this PR, we should note in the PR and add a TODO.
I do handle that. am I missing something?

Good javadoc describing purpose and usage would be helpful for future readers
Just to confirm --  There is one instance of TableCache per broker (via BaseBrokerRequestHandler created during broker start) and one instance per controller (created during controller start). Right?
yes. will add javadocs
Since we can get the schema name here itself, looks like we don't need the other map in SchemaChangeListener as noted further below in the comment
let me check, which map are you referring to
To _schemaMap as mentioned in this comment #4983 (comment)
Why do we need tableConfigMap? I don't see it being used
I was hoping this can replace the TableConfigCache we have in Realtime code.
I don't think this is needed. _schemaColumnMap should be enough.
I did not follow
ah got it. will remove it

Do you want to remove this map? getColumnName() function of TableCache will first use the TableConfigChangeListener._table2SchemaConfigMap to get the schema name for a table name. It will then use the SchemaChangeListener.getColumnName(schema name, column name) to get the internal column name.
So _schemaMap remains unused.
done
So if the listener is invoked for a change to a particular table, we are going to go over schema of all the tables to update the map? If so, I think we should handle the callback at a table level.

It makes the logic more complicated and there is batching where we can get only one callback and multiple tables changed in the same callback. We can instead optimize reading the contents by reading the stats. But given that schema and table configs rarely change. I dint bother optimizing it.
Since the other listener's map is sufficient to first get the schema name, this method and _schemaMap is probably not needed.
yes, just had it in case we need to get schema in the future but can remove it and add it back when we need it.

Unrelated to this PR but may be at some point we need to fix this?
Just to extract the table name, a query received on the controller via rest API will be compiled to BrokerRequest twice -- once at the controller and then at the broker.
yes, I realized that as well. Query console is generally used for debugging and not worth optimizing it.
